content.description:
Signs & Symptoms

NOTE: Anhedonia is the inability to enjoy oneself. Avolition is lack of motivation.
content.question: If a researcher wanted to do an experiment to examine if a biological treatment was successful for addressing the positive symptoms, which of the following might be an important ethical consideration?

choices.label: The control group would lead the debriefing after the study.
Individuals in the study would be randomly assigned to the control group.
The control group would receive the biological treatment.
The participants might not be able to give consent.

content.answer: The participants might not be able to give consent.

topic.text: 5.4: Selection of Categories of Psychological Disorders

skill.text: 2.D: Evaluate whether a psychological research scenario followed appropriate ethical procedures.
